content: A newsletter about Backdrop LIVE went out today. Are people seeing it in their mailboxes (besides @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) )?
i received it, really liked what I read, thank you for all your work around LIVE:-)
I also got the newsletter :thumbs_up:

Further to today's Outreach meeting, if all that's needed to do a newsletter is to login to a service, copy/paste the latest blog post or two into a box, format, then hit Send, I will volunteer to do that every release.
Is that all there is to it, @jenlampton?
If so, I can start with that, then once I have the hang of it maybe I can look at incorporating other things (what people are currently working on/need help with, upcoming events, etc.).
Yep, pretty much. We even have a template that should help with the formatting. You'd also need to send a test email and review it to make sure it looks okay, but yeah. Not much to it.
@jenlampton Sounds good. Want to PM/email me the details and I'll set myself a reminder every 4 months.
You may not need the reminder, the newsletter goes out the same time the release is pushed to Pantheon, so you may already be involved with that?
@StPaulTim do we have newsletter details documented in procedures?
@BWPanda we may need to add you to the marketing 1Password if you are not already on it

no docs. We should write somthing up and put it in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/tree/master/procedures

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

oops, wrong window. We don't have any docs yet, but we should write something up and put it in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/tree/master/procedures. @StPaulTim do you have time to work on that before Jan 30th?

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
If not ping me and let me know!
@jenlampton I don't have access to Marketing passwords, so feel free to add me there.

I heard this being discussed in the meeting and it seems like something so simple to do (but I understand everyone has their own time/family/etc. constraints). But since I used to work in a Church office as the treasurer/admin assistant a few years ago, and since the Pastor was a bit dyslexic and I was the one creating and sending the weekly newsletter, then I feel this should be something I can easily do.
weekly? you have so much experience!!!
@BWPanda I added you to marketing and also community since I was in there. you have all the passwords now :D
I will remember the creed: "With great power comes great responsibility" :smiling_face:

With everything, I look at things like "What would I want?"

"What would I want in a newsletter? (not in order)"

  • List of 1-5 recently ported modules - Link to module pages
  • A spotlight module that isn't well known but maybe worth checking out - Link to module page
  • Latest past release and 1-3 top features or reasons for the release (brief mention about major bugs that were taken care of or features that were added) - Link to release notes
  • Upcoming planned release, exciting features or fixes and expected date of release - Link to details if available?
  • Link to latest blog post or helpful tutorial / article (if any) with a shout-out to the author

Give or take, those are pieces of information that I would find "useful" in an ongoing backdrop newsletter. Keep them short, sweet, to the point with only the most relevant information. These would be nice to get monthly.

Additional Newsletter Content Ideas
Whenever a milestone release has dropped, a fanfare announcing its release and the top issues that were added/fixed with a link to the full release notes.

6-mo mark, a quick overview for the roadmap of what the next six months will look like:

  • Projected module ports (if any)
  • Projected features / fixes
  • Projected releases and dates

Start of the year, a roadmap for the year of what is projected to be accomplished for the platform and the organization.
This one would probably be the most in-depth and could be written in a blog style. Maybe throw in some Kudos to folks who made things happen.

Thanks @Phil Ward, that's really helpful! I've made a (more permanent) note of them here: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/177

Send regular newsletters 路 Issue #177 路 backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We need to do a better job of keeping our peeps up to date with what is going on in Backdrop. We started this by doing a better job with social media and writing regular blog posts but we should al...
Thanks for the ideas @Phil Ward ...although the 6-month mark should be 4 months in our case, since we always have a minor release every 4 months, on specific dates.
...I really like the idea of an annual review/summary of what was done in re to the project/contrib/infrastructure/documentation/community + projection/goals for next year :+1:

@klonos Yeah, I think it was @Luke McCormick (cellear) that brought that up in the outreach meeting today. Kind of like a "Note for the year" type of thing.

Some off-record discussions were about sitting down and hammering out some goals for 2021 after 1.18 drops. Probably late Jan early Feb from what I gathered.
Sounds good :+1:
@BWPanda - I'd like to schedule another VUG and get it into the newsletter. I'll try to do that today. It (the newsletter) hasn't been sent yet, has it?
@StPaulTim I believe it's scheduled for friday
I can send it whenever.
@StPaulTim Preparing to send newsletter. What do you want me to say re VUGs?
I'm working on something now.
@BWPanda - Do I have another hour (or so)?
Sure. 10:15am here now, and I have all day :blush:
Are we going to include mention of Jen's new blog post in the newsletter?
Not this issue. Already got a blog post in this one.
I think it would be a good idea. If even just the title and link.
ok
But I'm hoping newsletters can be monthly, so next month probably/
...next month is in a couple of days :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:

Well considering newsletters always come out 2 weeks after a minor release, and minor release always come out on the 15th of given months, then I figure the 29th is a good day to send a monthly newsletter. Then the minor release ones will synchronise andthere'll be equal spacing between them all throughout the year.
That's my plan anyway :smiling_face:
How's it coming @StPaulTim
You told me you had all day - then I got involved in something offline. Will wrap this up now.
Thanks for being patient.
No worries, and I do. Was just wondering. I can send it later tonight if that helps, in ~7 hrs time.
I just need about 15 minutes.
I want to get this over with. ;-)

@BWPanda - I dropped some text for the VUG on the newsletter. I tried to be brief. Feel free to edit or change it as you like. But, I wanted to give you something to get started.

I'm still updating the actual event nodes on BackdropCMS.org

I also changed the date of Backdrop CMS live from March 13 to March 12 to reflect the most recent discsussions.
Thanks for waiting for me.

@BWPanda - I didn't list the VUG on writing tests yet, because I don't really have a confirmed presenter. I still hope to do it next week, but am trying to get a presenter confirmed and want the option to change the date if necessary. Next Tues is pretty short notice. Also, I think that writing tests is a pretty niche topic.
We can promote the video recording in the next Newsletter.
'Sent' newsletter, but our account apparently has to be verified first, which sounds like a manual thing performed by the SendinBlue staff... So gotta wait now...
Hmm, that is weird. We've used it before.

Did Newsletter go out?
Is there something we need to do?
Just have to wait for them to manually review our account.
Then it'll go automatically after that.
yeah, I turned off the monthly-auto-renew since we were paying $25/mo and not using it. I expect this review process is related to turning it back on. :(
On the up-side, newsletters are only $15/mo from Sendgrid so there could be a potential savings for moving there.
Latest newsletter just went out
Looks great @BWPanda :+1: :pray:
